reviews.text: Hotel del Corso is a clean and nice hotel near the central station of Milano. It's a good combination of price/value although you can find cheaper hotels. Nice staff.
reviews.title: Good quality and central location

reviews.text: Stayed at this hotel for 2 nights at the end of August. Had to walk around Milan without our passports because at check in the front desk kept our passports for more than 3 hours (have been told to NEVER let your passport out of your sight).
reviews.title: Not so great

likes.disliked: — Pretty much everything previously listed in review.

reviews.text: Front desk person was somewhat rude towards us.
reviews.title: Good value and experience
Good value
reviews.text: The A/C in the rooms did not work well at all. A/C was off when we checked in and took the whole 2 nights to cool the room down.
Refridgerator didn't even work that well - did not keep items cool.
reviews.title: Good Hotel

reviews.text: Location: this hotel is a bit too out of the historical district for me. I like to be in the heart of things but this is a subway ride away. That said, there is a subway station right next to the hotel with a line directly into the historical district. The immediate area is a bit grubby. However due to everything else I would recommend.
reviews.title: Great value for money, comfortable, not great location.

reviews.text: Room: I had a single room which was €55 which included breakfast. This was amazing value. Although I had a single bed, the room was spacious as was the bathroom. It was spotlessly clean.
reviews.title: great hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast: just continental but extensive with real coffee.
reviews.title: value for money

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Service: with a smile and helpful.
reviews.title: Perfect location, faultless staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Ps. When you go out if the hotel and turn right, on the main road on the opposite corner, there is a pizzeria. Avoid. Worst Italian meal I have ever had with wine that looked and tasted like Ribena.
reviews.title: Great Value

reviews.text: I really enjoyed our stay at this hotel.We had booked a double and a triple room.Everyone in our company liked this hotel and we especially loved the gorgeous breakfast every moning!! I highly recommend this hotel.Simple but nice!
reviews.title: A nice hotel next to the underground station

reviews.text: The hotel is located 20 meters from the square Argentina and is easy to detect. Near it there are two Metro stops, supermarket and rezbire is famous Corso Buenos Aires, one of the major shopping streets in Milan. The hotel is clean, well maintained with friendly staff and good breakfast. The furniture in the rooms is standard for each 3-star hotel. There is not anything special at the hotel to justify 4 stars. I made ​​an unpleasant impression of the following facts: * When we arrived the sink was clogged and it was removed on the third day of our 4 day stay in Milan * The location of the third bed / I had booked a triple room with three beds! / Was opposite air conditioning! We were forced my son to transpose, part of the furniture to find an approachout of bed. These are not much bigger trouble and in no case can distort the pleasure of holiday, but its still annoying. Overall I recommend hotel for short stay and surely you will not be disappointed. These are both due to the fact that not give him high praise.
reviews.title: good hotel but not for 4 star

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We booked this hotel for the first night of our honeymoon through InItalia.it requesting a deluxe room. When we arrived we were very disappointed as the room was clearly just a standard double room, very basic. The bathroom was very small and the shower cabinet was tiny. We were told that there were no other rooms available. As it was only for one night we decided to stay as it was too late to organise anything else. The room was noisy with traffic as it was close to a large road junction which we had not expected. The breakfast was very poor with orange squash rather than fresh and Nescafe machine coffee which was awful; not what you expect in Italy! There was a very basic selection of bread rolls, croissants, plastic cheese and cheap ham. All in all, very far from four star standards.
reviews.title: This is not a 4 star hotel

reviews.text: We have stayed at Hotel del Corso for 5 nights. The Hotel is perfectly located, just 2 mins walk to Corso Buenos Aires a major shopping street. Both the main train station and the Duomo are only few stops by metro. The rooms are medium sized, but very clean, good bathroom, and always warm. Breakfast was good with fair variety. Rommel and Michella at the reception were very friendly and helpful. I would highly recommend this Hotel.
reviews.title: Very good quality/price ratio

reviews.text: The Del Corso Milano is a small, cosy hotel which met almost our needs for our vacation in Milan. The hotel staff are helpful in giving tips when they could although sometimes there was a bit of a communication breakdown even though they do speak English. Maps are available free of charge from the hotel and good enough for us to use to navigate ourselves.
reviews.title: Cosy Little Place

reviews.text: I will first of all say that the location of the hotel to the nearest metro stop is very good being only a 2 min walk. Duomo is only a few minutes train ride away from this metro. Location is the only positive comment i have unfortunately. The hotel promotes itself as a 4 star incorrectly. This hotel is actually 3 star rated in the hotel rating book. Personally, I would rate at best a 2 star. We stayed for one night and was thankful of this. There were bed bugs in my bed and when asked to change rooms, the staff stated no other available rooms to move us too. Breakfast was standard with cornflakes, bread. Staff were not overly friendly. There are no restaurants near this hotel and would not recommend walking anywhere in the neihbourhood after dark. If you are lucky to get a bed without bugs, would be maybe bearable as a stop over for a night and to head to duomo in the day. Personally, i don't think it is worth the risk and would look elsewhere for the price.
reviews.title: Bad experience- Bed bugs!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I booked this hotel upon reading good review on trip advisor. I was very dissapointed upon arrival as the front desk staff in this hotel was the least to say uninterested. We booked a room for 3 person. When we arrived we were given keys to our room and to our surprise the room was for 2 person. When I asked at the reception, the receptionist asked me if we could share it for the night. When we insisted that we booked month and half ago and are not willing to share, the receptionist gave another key and asked us to see for ourselves if that room was adequete. The room was located at the ground floor next to the reception and elevator plus when we opened the curtain, only view I get to see is the rubbish bins. This is tagged as 4 star hotel and I do not see which aspect of it that reflects four star. The location was alright as there was a tube station 100 metres from there. Overall I was very dissapointed with hotel receptionist though the lady that attened to us on the final day in the morning was pleasant. I strongly do not recomend this hotel.
reviews.title: Bad experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We spent 6 nights in hotel Del Corso, Milan in August 2009 and we can say with certainty that it was an excellent choice. Booked online with 62 euros per night.
reviews.title: Excellent choice

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Location is great. The metro station is just around the corner and it takes only 10 minutes to Duomo. Tram station (No. 33) is also very close connecting the hotel with the main train station. Pharmacy is just around the corner also, 24/7. Most important, the hotel is located on Via Buenos Aires – a main shopping street with all affordable brands.
reviews.title: Great Location, Great Value Hotel

reviews.text: The room (looking at the back) was quiet, spacious, clean and nicely furnished. Bathroom was clean and spacious too, only the shower door was defect. The towels were not changed once, however after our remark they did change them. They do not change every day the bed linens either. A/C worked fine.
reviews.title: Great Location - Great Hotel
